text: I don't suppose there's a secret parameter in the CTA HubL that I can use to add classes from within a custom module? Something like `{% cta guid="{{ module.cta }}" *class="pink-button"* %}` ?
Did you try the `extra_classes` parameter on this? <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates#parameters-available-for-all-modules>
That's exactly what I'm looking for, but it adds it to the wrapper and using the no_wrapper parameter doesn't help :disappointed:
hrmmm i see what you’re saying, the class gets added but the no_wrapper basically removes the wrapper that then has that class. :thinking_face:
Where would you be expecting the class to be added to? Are you looking for it to be on `<a>` element?
Yep, because the stylesheet already has all the CTA classes I was hoping to just piggyback off those, but I guess I'll just update it to style the CTA inside the wrapper with that class.
Yeah, just like when you add classes in the CTA tool, my client wants to avoid having to create the CTA several times to have it in different colours
So just one CTA and add classes to it at the page level using a custom module
I’ll take this feedback to the team. In the meantime, can you add this request to our ideas forum on the community?
